intro: Corydalis amabilis, commonly known as the sweet corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern China. The plant produces delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Corydalis amabilis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
